00055 [scriptable, uuid(3cb74885-8dd7-4261-a300-740da293e339)]
00056 interface sbIMediaList : sbIMediaItem
00057 {
00062   /*
00063   Prop: name
00064   
00065   The name of the media list.
00066 
00067   Type:
00068     String
00069 
00070   Example:
00071     (start code)
00072     //Create or get a library.
00073     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00074 
00075     //Create a medialist.
00076     var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00077 
00078     //Give it a name.
00079     mediaList.name = "80's hits";
00080     (end)
00081   */
00082   attribute AString name;
00083 
00088   /*
00089   Prop: type
00090 
00091   The type of this media list.
00092 
00093   Type:
00094     String
00095 
00096   Example:
00097     (start code)
00098     //Create or get a library.
00099     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00100 
00101     //Create a medialist.
00102     var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00103 
00104     //Tell everyone this is a simple medialist.
00105     alert("Hello everyone, this is a " + mediaList.type + " medialist!");
00106     (end)
00107   */
00108   readonly attribute AString type;
00109 
00114   /*
00115   Prop: length
00116 
00117   The length (in number of items) present in the media list.
00118 
00119   Type:
00120     Number
00121 
00122   Example:
00123     (start code)
00124     //Create or get a library.
00125     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00126 
00127     //Create a mediaitem.
00128     var mediaItem = library.createMediaItem("http://path/to/item.mp3");
00129 
00130     //Create a medialist.
00131     var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00132 
00133     //Add same item twice. We now have mediaItem at index 0 and 1.
00134     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00135     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00136 
00137     //Tell everyone there are 2 tracks in the medialist.
00138     alert("There are " + mediaList.length + " mediaitems in the medialist.");
00139     (end)
00140   */
00141   readonly attribute unsigned long length;
00142 
00147   /*
00148   Prop: isEmpty
00149 
00150   Is the <MediaList> empty?
00151 
00152   Type:
00153     Boolean
00154 
00155   Returns:
00156     true - <MediaList> is empty.
00157     false - <MediaList> is _not_ empty.
00158 
00159   Example:
00160     (start code)
00161     //Create or get a library.
00162     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00163 
00164     //Create a mediaitem.
00165     var mediaItem = library.createMediaItem("http://path/to/item.mp3");
00166 
00167     //Create a medialist.
00168     var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00169 
00170     //Add same item twice. We now have mediaItem at index 0 and 1.
00171     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00172     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00173 
00174     //Clear the medialist.
00175     mediaList.clear();
00176 
00177     //Check to see if the mediaList is empty.
00178     //The property in this case will be true.
00179     var empty = mediaList.isEmpty;
00180     (end)
00181   */
00182   readonly attribute boolean isEmpty;
00183 
00190   /*
00191   Func: getItemByGuid()
00192 
00193   Get a <MediaItem> from the <MediaList> by using it's <MediaItem::guid>.
00194 
00195   Prototype:
00196     <MediaItem> getItemByGuid(String guid);
00197 
00198   Parameters:
00199     guid - The global unique identifier (<MediaItem::guid>) of the <MediaItem>.
00200 
00201   Returns:
00202     The <MediaItem> with the requested guid.
00203 
00204   Throws:
00205     Not Available (Components.results.NS_ERROR_NOT_AVAILABLE)
00206     when there is no <MediaItem> with the requested guid.
00207 
00208   Example:
00209     (start code)
00210     //Create or get a library.
00211     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00212 
00213     //Create a mediaitem.
00214     var mediaItem = library.createMediaItem("http://path/to/item.mp3");
00215 
00216     //Create a medialist.
00217     var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00218 
00219     //Add same item twice. We now have mediaItem at index 0 and 1.
00220     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00221 
00222     //Get the same item by guid.
00223     var sameMediaItem = mediaList.getItemByGuid(mediaItem.guid);
00224     (end)
00225 
00226   See Also:
00227     <getItemByIndex()>
00228     <indexOf()>
00229     <lastIndexOf()>
00230     <contains()>
00231   */
00232   sbIMediaItem getItemByGuid(in AString aGuid);

00240   /*
00241   Func: getItemByIndex()
00242 
00243   Get a <MediaItem> from the <MediaList> by using it's index in the <MediaList>.
00244 
00245   Prototype:
00246     <MediaItem> getItemByIndex(Number index)
00247 
00248   Parameters:
00249     index - The index of the <MediaItem>. Index starts at 0.
00250 
00251   Returns:
00252     The <MediaItem> present at the requested index.
00253 
00254   Throws:
00255     Not Available (Components.results.NS_ERROR_NOT_AVAILABLE) 
00256     when there is no <MediaItem> at the requested index.
00257 
00258   Example:
00259     (start code)
00260     //Create or get a library.
00261     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00262 
00263     //Create a mediaitem.
00264     var mediaItem = library.createMediaItem("http://path/to/item.mp3");
00265 
00266     //Create a medialist.
00267     var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00268 
00269     //Add same item twice. We now have mediaItem at index 0 and 1.
00270     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00271     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00272     
00273     //Get the mediaitem at index 1.
00274     var sameMediaItem = mediaList.getItemByIndex(1);
00275     (end)
00276   
00277   See Also:
00278     <getItemByGuid()>
00279     <indexOf()>
00280     <lastIndexOf()>
00281     <contains()>
00282   */
00283   sbIMediaItem getItemByIndex(in unsigned long aIndex);

00294   /*
00295   Const: ENUMERATIONTYPE_SNAPSHOT
00296 
00297   If this constant is specified when calling <enumerateAllItems()> or 
00298   <enumerateItemsByProperty()>, the EnumerationListener will recieve 
00299   a copy of the <MediaItem> instead of the <MediaItem> present in 
00300   the <MediaList>.
00301 
00302   Note:
00303     This is the *suggested* constant to be used when calling <enumerateAllItems()>
00304     or <enumerateItemsByProperty()>.
00305 
00306     Any properties changed on the copy of the <MediaItem> will also be
00307     reflected in the <MediaItem> present in the list.
00308 
00309   Example:
00310     (start code)
00311     //This example assumes you already have a medialist in the variable named "mediaList".
00312     //It also assumes that you have an enumeration listener in the variable named "enumListener".
00313 
00314     mediaList.enumerateAllItems(enumListener, 0);
00315     (end)
00316 
00317   See Also:
00318     <ENUMERATIONTYPE_LOCKING>
00319     <enumerateAllItems()>
00320     <enumerateItemsByProperty()>
00321   */
00322   const unsigned short ENUMERATIONTYPE_SNAPSHOT = 0;
00323 
00335   /*
00336   Const: ENUMERATIONTYPE_LOCKING
00337 
00338   If this constant is specified when calling <enumerateAllItems()> or 
00339   <enumerateItemsByProperty()> the EnumerationListener will recieve 
00340   the actual <MediaItem> from the <MediaList>.
00341 
00342   Note:
00343     This is the _suggested_ constant to use when attempting to change a lot of properties
00344     on <MediaItems>, or when you need to process them individually without calling any other 
00345     functions on the <MediaList> during enumeration.
00346 
00347   Example:
00348     (start code)
00349     //This example assumes you already have a medialist in the variable named "mediaList".
00350     //It also assumes that you have an enumeration listener in the variable named "enumListener".
00351 
00352     mediaList.enumerateAllItems(enumListener, 1);
00353     (end)
00354 
00355   See Also:
00356     <ENUMERATIONTYPE_SNAPSHOT>
00357     <enumerateAllItems()>
00358     <enumerateItemsByProperty()>
00359   */
00360   const unsigned short ENUMERATIONTYPE_LOCKING  = 1;
00361

00370   Func: enumerateAllItems()
00371 
00372   Enumerate all <MediaItems> in the <MediaList>.
00373   
00374   Prototype:
00375     enumerateAllItems(EnumerationListener enumListener, Number enumType)
00376 
00377   Parameters:
00378     enumListener - An EnumerationListener object. See example below.
00379     enumType - The type of enumeration desired. Valid values for enumType 
00380                are <ENUMERATIONTYPE_SNAPSHOT> and <ENUMERATIONTYPE_LOCKING>.
00381 
00382   Example:
00383     (start code)
00384     (end)
00385 
00386   See Also:
00387     <ENUMERATIONTYPE_SNAPSHOT>
00388     <ENUMERATIONTYPE_LOCKING>
00389     <enumerateItemsByProperty()>
00390   */
00391   void enumerateAllItems(in sbIMediaListEnumerationListener aEnumerationListener,
00392                          in unsigned short aEnumerationType);

00404   /*
00405   Func: enumerateItemsByProperty()
00406 
00407   Enumerate the <MediaItems> in the <MediaList> that have a certain property
00408   and value match.
00409 
00410   This function is useful if you are looking for all items having, for example,
00411   an artistName value of "Tom Waits".
00412 
00413   Prototype:
00414     enumerateItemsByProperty(String name, String value, EnumerationListener enumListener)
00415 
00416   Parameters:
00417     name - The name of the property to match.
00418     value - The value of the property to match.
00419     enumListener - The enumeration listener.
00420     enumType - The type of enumeration desired. Valid values for enumType 
00421                are <ENUMERATIONTYPE_SNAPSHOT> and <ENUMERATIONTYPE_LOCKING>.
00422 
00423   Example:
00424     (start code)
00425     (end)
00426 
00427   See Also:
00428     <ENUMERATIONTYPE_SNAPSHOT>
00429     <ENUMERATIONTYPE_LOCKING>
00430     <enumerateAllItems()>
00431   */
00432   void enumerateItemsByProperty(in AString aPropertyName,
00433                                 in AString aPropertyValue,
00434                                 in sbIMediaListEnumerationListener aEnumerationListener,
00435                                 in unsigned short aEnumerationType);

00457   /*
00458   Func: indexOf()
00459 
00460   Get the index for a <MediaItem> present in the <MediaList>.
00461 
00462   Prototype:
00463     Number indexOf(<MediaItem> mediaItem, Number startFrom)
00464 
00465   Parameters:
00466     mediaItem - The <MediaItem> to find.
00467     startFrom - The index position at which to start searching. Index starts at 0.
00468 
00469   Returns:
00470     The index where the <MediaItem> was first found.
00471 
00472   Throws:
00473     Not Available (Components.results.NS_ERROR_NOT_AVAILABLE) 
00474     when the <MediaItem> cannot be found.
00475 
00476   Example:
00477     (start code)
00478     //Create or get a library.
00479     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00480 
00481     //Create a mediaitem.
00482     var mediaItem = library.createMediaItem("http://path/to/item.mp3");
00483 
00484     //Create a medialist.
00485     var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00486 
00487     //Add same item twice. We now have mediaItem at index 0 and 1.
00488     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00489     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00490     
00491     //Get the first occurrence of mediaItem.
00492     //The returned value in this case will be 0.
00493     var index = mediaList.indexOf(mediaItem, 0);
00494     (end)
00495 
00496   See Also:
00497     <lastIndexOf()>
00498     <contains()>
00499   */
00500   unsigned long indexOf(in sbIMediaItem aMediaItem,
00501                         in unsigned long aStartFrom);

00565 
00566   Verify that this <MediaList> contains the requested <MediaItem>.

00568   Prototype:

00572     mediaItem - The <MediaItem> to verify.
00573 
00574   Returns:
00575     true - The <MediaItem> *is present* in the <MediaList>.
00576     false - The <MediaItem> *is _not_ present*.
00577

00582

00585 
00586     //Create a medialist.

00588

00590     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00591     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00592     
00593     //Check to see if mediaList contains mediaItem.
00594     //The returned value in this case will be true.
00595     var containsItem = mediaList.contains(mediaItem;
00596     (end)
00597

00599     <indexOf()>
00600     <lastIndexOf()>
00601   */

00681   /*
00682   Func: remove()
00683 
00684   Remove the first occurrence of the given <MediaItem> from this <MediaList>.
00685 
00686   Prototype:
00687     remove(<MediaItem> mediaItem)
00688 
00689   Parameters:
00690     mediaItem - The <MediaItem> to remove.
00691 
00692   Example:
00693     (start code)
00694     //Create or get a library.
00695     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00696 
00697     //Create a mediaitem.
00698     var mediaItem = library.createMediaItem("http://path/to/item.mp3");
00699 
00700     //Create a medialist.
00701     var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00702 
00703     //Add same item twice. We now have mediaItem at index 0 and 1.
00704     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00705     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00706 
00707     //Remove the first occurrence of the mediaitem.
00708     mediaList.remove(mediaItem);
00709 
00710     ... //Now only the second occurrence remains and it's index is now 0.
00711     (end)
00712 
00713   See Also:
00714     <add()>
00715     <addAll()>
00716     <removeByIndex()>
00717   */
00718   void remove(in sbIMediaItem aMediaItem);

00749     var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00750 
00751     //Add same item twice. We now have mediaItem at index 0 and 1.
00752     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00753     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00754     
00755     //Remove the duplicate item.
00756     mediaList.removeByIndex(1);
00757     (end)

00776   /*
00777   Func: clear()
00778 
00779   Clear the <MediaList>. This will remove all <MediaItems> from this <MediaList>.
00780 
00781   Prototype:
00782     clear()
00783 
00784   Note:
00785     This is the *preferred* way to remove all <MediaItems> from a <MediaList> 
00786     because it is optimized for speed.
00787 
00788   Example:
00789     (start code)
00790     //Create or get a library.
00791     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00792 
00793     //Create a mediaitem.
00794     var mediaItem = library.createMediaItem("http://path/to/item.mp3");
00795 
00796     //Create a medialist.
00797     var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00798 
00799     //Add same item twice. We now have mediaItem at index 0 and 1.
00800     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00801     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00802 
00803     ... //Do something with the medialist.
00804 
00805     //Clear the medialist.
00806     mediaList.clear();
00807 
00808     //Check to see if the medialist is empty.
00809     //The property in this case will be true.
00810     var empty = mediaList.isEmpty;
00811     (end)
00812   */
00813   void clear();

00875   /*
00876   Func: getDistinctValuesForProperty()
00877 
00878   Get all distinct (unique) values in this <MediaList> for a given property.
00879 
00880   This function is useful if you want to know all the unique artistName property
00881   values for example.
00882 
00883   Prototype:

00885 
00886   Parameters:
00887     name - The name of the property for which all distinct values are desired.

00890     Enumerator, contains Strings.
00891 
00892   Example:
00893     (start code)
00894     (end)
00895 
00896   See Also:
00897     <enumerateItemsByProperty()>
00898     
00899     <http://publicsvn.songbirdnest.com/browser/trunk/components/property/src/sbStandardProperties.h>, for a list of standard properties.
00900   */
